title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree died following an e-bike accident in Copley Square on August 6.
Dang was struck near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street and succumbed to life-threatening injuries at a hospital.
The e-bike operator remained at the scene and no charges have been filed, according to police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience high tides this fall due to perigean spring tides caused by the moon's orbit.
The Stone Living Lab refers to these as 'wicked high tides,' with levels two to four feet above normal.
High tide events will be held at Long Wharf, starting on Thursday, September 11, at 2:30 p.m.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, saying he's tough and receptive to criticism despite recent struggles.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in loss to Raiders.
Stefon Diggs debuted with the Patriots, making six catches for 57 yards after returning from an ACL injury.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A state audit found DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports in Massachusetts K-12 schools.
Audit revealed DESE delayed addressing special education complaints, averaging a 111-day delay for 28% of cases.
DESE did not fulfill obligations to the Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth, failing to provide required materials and training.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, 31, was fatally shot during a political event at Utah Valley University, sparking widespread condemnation.
Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey and Senator Elizabeth Warren denounced the shooting as horrific and called for an end to political violence.
Authorities have not publicly identified a suspect but believe only one person was involved in Kirk's shooting.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez, Harold Landry, Morgan Moses did not practice for the Patriots due to various injuries.
Gonzalez has been out since July 28 with a lingering hamstring injury, affecting Patriots' defensive lineup.
Morgan Moses' absence due to a foot injury could impact Patriots' offensive line in Week 2 against the Dolphins.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye admits to rushed throws in Patriots' loss to the Raiders, wishing to have some passes back.
Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting 1-for-3 opportunities while Raiders scored on their sole chance.
Maye feels the team needs to start faster and improve red zone efficiency to boost offensive performance.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown remains committed to the Celtics with four years left on his contract, despite trade rumors.
Brown expressed openness to playing for the Atlanta Hawks, his hometown team, in the future.
The Celtics are retooling their roster due to Jayson Tatum's injury and key offseason departures.

title: What’s causing vibration in my 15-year-old car?
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2010 Mazda Miata with 39,000 miles experiences a front vibration at highway speeds, prompting tire balance concerns.
Possible causes for the vibration include tire flat spots or issues with wheel roundness, according to AAA's John Paul.
Steering and suspension wear could exacerbate vibrations, and inspections are recommended when performing tire or wheel work.

title: 17-year-old stabbed inside Roxbury high school, no arrests, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A 17-year-old was stabbed in a hallway at Madison Park High School in Roxbury at noon Wednesday.
The student suffered a minor, non-life threatening wound and was transported to a hospital for treatment.
No arrests have been made; both Madison Park and John D. O’Bryant schools were briefly in safe mode.
